snippet: Congo isn’t too big to fail; it’s too big to succeed. Rather than striving to hold it together, we should let it break up.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Africa Center director J Peter Pham, addressing latest eruption of violence in the Congo, maintains the country should be allowed to break up into smaller organic units; holds the Congo remains poor and unstable, despite its vast resources, because it is an artificial relic of the colonial period.
lead_paragraph: Congo isn’t too big to fail; it’s too big to succeed. Rather than striving to hold it together, we should let it break up.

headline.main: To Save Congo, Let It Fall Apart
